Chapter 3 RStudio Tips, Tricks, and Shortcuts Shortcuts in Rstudio Rstudio offers a series of shortcuts to speed up some tasks when you are working in R. Here are some of the most common and useful shortcuts: Working on the Code Editor 1- Press Alt GR + - you can get the <-, which is used to designate elements in R. 2- Hide code: press Alt + L. 3- Execute code: press Ctrl+Enter when executing the code line by line. Ctrl+Alt+R to run the complete code. Working in dplyr 1- Press ctrl + shift + M you can get the %>% (dplyr: pipe operator), which is used to make the command line continue on the next line.
